And she laughed, From the bottom of her throat, from right behind that small finger-shaped hollow, which is the best place to laugh from. She released her grievances like handfuls of birdseed: They are there, and they are gone.
author: Gillian Flynn, Gone Girl
category: amy, change, dangerous, love, misperception, wife

quote: Always being there was the essential secret for a wife.
author: Elizabeth von Arnim, The Enchanted April

quote: No wife wants to hear that her husband is less than perfect.
author: Sophie Kinsella, Shopaholic & Baby

quote: We don’t treat each other very well, I suppose. Even from the start. It was as though we had the seven-year itch the day we met. The day she went into a coma, I heard her telling her friend Shelley that I was useless, that I leave my socks hanging on every doorknob in the house. At weddings we roll our eyes at the burgeoning love around us, the vows that we know will morph into new kinds of promises: I vow not to kiss you when you’re trying to read. I will tolerate you in sickness and ignore you in health. I promise to let you watch that stupid news show about celebrities, since you’re so disenchanted with your own life.Joanie and I were urged by her brother, Barry, to subject ourselves to counseling as a decent couple would. Barry is a man of the couch, a believer in weekly therapy, affirmations, and pulse points. Once he tried to show us exercises he’d been doing in session with his girlfriend. We were instructed to trade reasons, abstract or specific, why we stayed with each other. I started off by saying that Joanie would get drunk and pretend I was someone else and do this neat thing with her tongue. Joanie said tax breaks. Barry cried. Openly. His second wife had recently left him for someone who understood that a man didn’t do volunteer work.
author: Kaui Hart Hemmings, The Descendants
category: husband, joanie-king, marriage, matt-king, wedding, wife

quote: If I could cook I wouldn’t have to study my ass off at school and I would have tried to find a man to support me as his lovely wife.
author: C.S.  James, Blue Ice

quote: The doctor's wife ate two apples a day, just to be safe. But her husband kept coming home.
author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, The Tiny Book of Tiny Stories, Vol. 1

quote: [On what young husbands should say to their wives:] I have taken you in my arms, and I love you, and I prefer you to my life itself. For the present life is nothing, and my most ardent dream is to spend it with you in such a way that we may be assured of not being separated in the life reserved for us... I place your love above all things, and nothing would be more bitter or painful to me than to be of a different mind than you.
author: John Chrysostom
category: agape, god, husband, inspirational, life, love, marriage, philosophy, relationships, romance, wife, wisdom

quote: What kind of husband would I be if I bet against my own marriage?'I smiled. 'The stupid kind. Didn't you listen to your dad when he told you not to bet against me?
author: Jamie McGuire, Beautiful Disaster
category: bet, certainty, humor, husband, husband-and-wife, love, making-it-last, marriage, stupid-kind, wife

quote: They saw her husband, this giant of a man in God’s Kingdom, this man, that for over fifteen years was their example of what a great man and husband looked like, walking up to his weeping wife, gently embracing her, soothing her, lifting and holding her soul up high while she released her own pains and worries from the last two days, feeling him, leaning into him, and submitting her pain and fears to her husband out of her love and trust. His strength was shown in his softness. He was made strong in his wife’s pain. He was her man of God
author: Lee  Goff, A Wrath Like Thunder
category: good-husband, husband, husband-and-wife, inspirational, man-of-god, wife

quote: Every man is a bachelor out of his wife's sight!
author: Margaret Way, A Lesson in Loving

quote: Why wasn't there an etiquette book for runaway wives?
author: Anne Tyler, Ladder of Years

quote: He that hath wife and children hath given hostages to fortune.
author: Sorcha MacMurrough, The Matchless Miss

quote: My wife is a lovely leathery green, the blue-tongued lizard said;Her eyes are as red as bulldog ants, lurking in holes in her head;Her body is made of the speckled grass, a violet grows on her tongue,And I could watch her for fifty years if nobody blundered along.
author: Douglas Stewart

quote: He, who beats his wife defies his goddess
author: Akinwale Musa Oluseun

quote: My dad, who my mom always refers to as DH for Darling Husband, was protrayed as a 'let's look on the bright side of things' kind of guy, the pillar my everbumbling mother leans on in times of distress.
author: Frances O'Roark Dowell, Ten Miles Past Normal

quote: They had a saying: An Arab loves in the order of: his son, his camel, and his wife - but there were times when one was allowed to take precedence over the other!
author: Margaret Rome, Palace of the Hawk
category: arab, arabs, camel, love, son, wife

quote: With all due respect," Christopher muttered, "this conversation is leading nowhere. At least one of you should point out that Beatrix deserves a better man.""That's what I said about my wife," Leo remarked. "Which is why I married her before she could find one.
author: Lisa Kleypas, Love in the Afternoon

quote: One wife, you're happy, two and you're tired, three and they'll hate each other, four and they'll hate you.
author: Patrick Rothfuss, The Name of the Wind

quote: The marriage is a bribe to make a housekeeper think she is a householder.
author: Thornton Wilder, The Matchmaker

quote: She wisely reasoned that my chosen husband was no ordinary man, that his whole life was absolutely dedicated to God and His service, ad that I must never, never hinder him by trying to put myself first in his heart.
author: Susannah Spurgeon

quote: The owner of the Agut d'Avignon had the air of a 1920s dandy who had ruined himself with one mad night of gambling at baccarat and had only been saved by this restaurant, which he seemed to cherish as if it were his wife or a good fountain pen.
author: Manuel Vázquez Montalbán, La Soledad Del Manager
category: baccarat, fountain-pen, gambling, restaurant, ruin, wife

quote: there are no houses to wife. only window seats to occupy when the weather needs changing & waters to flow past our ankles on Sundays as we fish.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker

quote: ...there’s few on Earth as can cut a man deeper than his childless wife.
author: Craig      Russell, Black Bottle Man

quote: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot." -
author: Michael Altshuler

quote: Procrastination is the foundation of all disasters.
author: Pandora Poikilos, Excuse Me, My Brains Have Stepped Out

quote: He who every morning plans the transactions of that day and follows that plan carries a thread that will guide him through the labyrinth of the most busy life.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: You get to decide where your time goes. You can either spend it moving forward, or you can spend it putting out fires. You decide. And if you don't decide, others will decide for you.
author: Tony Morgan

quote: Life was not to be sitting in hot amorphic leisure in my backyard idly writing or not-writing, as the spirit moved me. It was, instead, running madly, in a crowded schedule, in a squirrel cage of busy people. Working, living, dancing, dreaming, talking, kissing — singing, laughing, learning. The responsibility, the awful responsibility of managing (profitably) 12 hours a day for 10 weeks is rather overwhelming when there is nothing, noone, to insert an exact routine into the large unfenced acres of time — which it is so easy to let drift by in soporific idling and luxurious relaxing. It is like lifting a bell jar off a securely clockwork-like functioning community, and seeing all the little busy people stop, gasp, blow up and float in the inrush, (or rather outrush,) of the rarified scheduled atmosphere — poor little frightened people, flailing impotent arms in the aimless air. That's what it feels like: getting shed of a routine. Even though one had rebelled terribly against it, even then, one feels uncomfortable when jounced out of the repetitive rut. And so with me. What to do? Where to turn? What ties, what roots? as I hang suspended in the strange thin air of back-home?
author: Sylvia Plath, The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quote: You can't make up for lost time. You can only do better in the future.
author: Ashley Ormon

quote: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Yale Richmond, Understanding the Americans: A Handbook for Visitors to the United States

quote: You must excuse my gruff conduct,” the watchdog said, after they’d been driving for some time, “but you see it’s traditional for watchdogs to be ferocious.
author: Norton Juster, The Phantom Tollbooth

quote: One always has time enough, if one will apply it well.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: A precondition for reading good books is not reading bad ones: for life is short.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer, On the Suffering of the World

quote: water flow away and never come back
author: Sarita

quote: Musicians, like golfers, have to put their minds in the right place – trusting, confident, enjoying the pressure, being in present. And so forth. Otherwise, no amount of practice or “Time management” will make them better. The same is true in all professions: if you’re stuck in the Training Mindset, evaluating yourself, or thinking in the past or future, you will not perform up to your potential. You will waste a lot of time, be an inefficient performer, and likely assume you need to manage your time better. In reality you need to manage your thinking better.
author: John Eliot, Overachievement: The New Science of Working Less to Accomplish More

quote: Truth flows from universal law, not personal views.
author: John Agno, Can't Get Enough Leadership: Book Notes & Coaching Tips
category: boomer-life-tips, boomer-retirement, leadership-books, leadership-tips, life-signature, stress-management, time-management, women-and-time

quote: Add value too your time, chill out with good people.
author: Sravani Saha Nakhro

quote: Every moment, if properly utilized, has the potential to transcend space and time.
author: Haresh Sippy

quote: Most of your time is spent in doing tasks which barely contribute to the results. The tasks which keep you busy and engaged instead favouring your efforts. Not everything that you do is important. Just a fraction of it is.
author: Vishal Ostwal, Pocket Productivity: A Simplified Guide to Getting More Outcomes from Your Hard Work and Giving Your Hustle a Meaning

quote: Time has wings and it can fly . A second spent wastefully can never be regained, a minute spent wisely is memorable and an hour spent well becomes an history.
author: Adewale Osunsakin, Time To Awake Christian Magazine

quote: We were never supposed to worship time like we worship the sun and the light it brings.The only gift that time brings us, as human beings, is a signal that our life here on Earth is not permanent, it is fleeting.
author: Courtney Beck, Conversations with Krishna

quote: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.
author: William Penn

quote: Burnout occurs when your body and mind can no longer keep up with the tasks you demand of them. Don’t try to force yourself to do the impossible. Delegate time for important tasks, but always be sure to leave time for relaxation and reflection.
author: Del Suggs, Truly Leading: Lessons in Leadership

quote: The hands of the clock are ever in the hands of God. It is arrogant to plan without planning for God.
author: David Mathis, Habits of Grace: Enjoying Jesus through the Spiritual Disciplines

quote: Every task that requires completion today, left undone, turns into a double task for tomorrow.
author: Sravani Saha Nakhro

quote: Work on Purpose - Play on Purpose -Rest on Purpose -Do not let yourself or anyone else waste your time.
author: Izey Victoria Odiase
category: intention, intentional, intentional-living, on-purpose, time, time-is-priceless, time-management, waste-of-time, wasting-time

quote: Do not waste time attempting to make sense out of nonsense.
author: Johnnie Dent Jr.

quote: There will never be a point in my life where it is acceptable to waste time.
author: Carlos Wallace, The Other 99 T.Y.M.E.S: Train Your Mind to Enjoy Serenity
category: carlos-wallace, time, time-management, time-quotes, waste-of-time, wasted-time, wasting-time

quote: Every thought, every action, every statement should have meaning.
author: Carlos Wallace, The Other 99 T.Y.M.E.S: Train Your Mind to Enjoy Serenity
category: carlos-wallace, time, time-management, time-quotes, waste-of-time, wasted-time, wastefulness

quote: I am definitely going to take a course on time management... just as soon as I can work it into my schedule.
author: Louis E. Boone

quote: Don’t try to find the time, make the time.
author: Ben Tolosa, Masterplan Your Success

quote: You can’t manage time. You can only manage your life. You can’t strategically plan time, you can only plan your life.
author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

quote: The quickest way to run out of time is to think you have enough of it,
author: Stewart Stafford
category: complacency, time, time-management, time-quotes, wasting-time, wasting-time-quotes

quote: The light of a great man shines for generations to come.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: Lose an hour in the morning and you'll be looking for it all day.
author: Irish proverb

quote: We each have 24 hours in a given day
author: how we choose to spend each moment determines how spent we are”! EL

quote: Each delegated task must be both time-consuming and well-defined. If you’re running around like a chicken with its head cut off and assign your VA to do that for you, it doesn’t improve the order of the universe.
author: Timothy Ferriss, The 4-Hour Workweek

quote: Some people exert more energy on less important things
author: some people exert less energy on less important things.
category: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah, Distinctive Footprints of Life: Where Are You Heading Towards?

quote: People nowadays take time far more seriously than eternity. – Thomas Kelly
author: John Ortberg Jr., The Life You've Always Wanted: Spiritual Disciplines for Ordinary People

quote: Irony of the Fact:Half of our time we waste, thinking how to manage our time.
author: Sachin Panwar

quote: Every minute we waste in frustration over a task that seems overwhelming is a minute subtracted from the time we've allotted to enjoy life.
author: Marc Mancini, Time Management

quote: Don't waste time with people who waste time. Time is precious, fragile as a butterfly wing, meaningful as an orgasm.
author: Chloe Thurlow, A Girl's Adventure

quote: If something is not a "hell, YEAH!", then it's a "no!
author: James Altucher

quote: If you don't steal time, time will loot you.
author: Hare Krishna Chandrasekaran

quote: If you fail to treat the current time you have wisely and with care, it’ll judge you tomorrow harshly since it came to you but you mistreated and abused it.
author: Assegid Habtewold

quote: The present presses automatically on you. The future does not. To attend to the future requires bandwidth, which scarcity taxes. When scarcity taxes our bandwidth, we become even more focused on the here and now. We need cognitive resources to gauge future needs, and we need executive control to resist present temptations. As it taxes our bandwidth, scarcity focuses on the present, and leads us to borrow.
author: Sendhil Mullainathan, Scarcity: Why Having Too Little Means So Much

quote: If you're 5-minutes early, you're late "How to always be on time
author: Phillip Gary Smith, HARMONIZING: Keys to Living in the Song of Life

quote: l can't manage time.But I can control my 24 hours to be valuable
author: Mohammed Sekouty

quote: You can never lose time and get it back again.
author: Kevin Kruse, 15 Secrets Successful People Know About Time Management: The Productivity Habits of 7 Billionaires, 13 Olympic Athletes, 29 Straight-A Students, and 239 Entrepreneurs

quote: You need to start paying other people to do stuff for you even before you feel you are ready.
author: Kevin Kruse, 15 Secrets Successful People Know About Time Management: The Productivity Habits of 7 Billionaires, 13 Olympic Athletes, 29 Straight-A Students, and 239 Entrepreneurs

quote: First, be ruthless about your calendar—stick to it, hell or high water but create space for unstructured time as well.
author: Arjun Dev Arora

quote: Most try to fight the Truth of Time every day.
author: Dave Crenshaw

quote: Hard work is often the easy work you did not do at the proper time.
author: Bernard Meltzer

quote: When one faces two ghuls, waste no time wishing for fewer.
author: Saladin Ahmed, Throne of the Crescent Moon

quote: He who knows most grieves most for wasted time.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Time doesn't need to be found, it is in plain sight ticking away loudly all the time. How we use it is the only question.
author: Don Aslett

quote: The greatest thing that gives me peace about time is knowing that I get to make choices about what I do with it. I also find it amazing that when there is something I really want to do, I find the time for it.
author: Sheri Kaye Hoff, Relax Into Inspired Action: Connect the Pieces and Live Fulfilled

quote: Just like us, successful people are also given 24 hours each day. The only differences between them and unsuccessful individuals are their winner mindset and self discipline.
author: Kevin J.  Donaldson, 10 Secrets of the New Rich: How To Join The World's New Breed Of Millionaires

quote: The rate of delay is in direct proportion to the urgency of arrival.
author: Doug Prebble

quote: As much as I enjoyed yoga courses, it was hard to make time for them. Generally speaking, my work arrangements were flexible, so it was mostly a psychological problem: it was hard to convince myself it was acceptable to go twist my body into knots for two hours when there was work to be done.
author: Josh Kaufman, The First 20 Hours: How to Learn Anything...Fast

quote: We have all another or different Life and Free time.Jan Jansen
author: Jan Jansen

quote: Don't wait for the perfect moment, take the moment and make it perfect.
author: kokonda nikhil kumar

quote: Don't wait for the perfect moment,take the moment and make it perfect.
author: Nikhil Kumar

quote: Those who waste time are the people who won the sperm race by mistake.
author: PRIYANSHU JOSHI

quote: Time is not money because it never returns.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: Time is an illusion, timing is an art.
author: Stefan Emunds
category: investment-advice, self-help-inspiration, success, time, time-management, timing, timing-is-everything

quote: Multi-tasking is great in the kitchen when you are trying to time the chicken to be ready at the same time as the potatoes. But do not assume it is a great way to manage a workday.
author: Joanne Tombrakos, It Takes An Egg Timer, A Guide to Creating the Time for Your Life

quote: There’s never enough time for all the naps you want.
author: Carolyn V. Hamilton

quote: The best time management tool is a clearly defined and definite purpose for your life.
author: Tom Cunningham

quote: Don't spend time its very precious - utilize it constructively.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: The young will not always be young, the famous will not always be relevant, the outspoken will not always have a voice. Make the most of now.
author: Olarewaju Oladipo, 3SqMeals Tweets: Not Your Typical Meal - Volume 2

quote: Time is the only commodity that is irreplaceable: invest it, share it, spend it...but never waste it.
author: Tracy Sherwood

quote: No one can save time. It’s not like money. You can’t deposit the time you save into an account and use it later. Time passes. Time is a constantly depleting resource. Once it’s gone, it’s gone, and you will NEVER get it back.
author: Gudjon Bergmann, Yes! You Can Manage Stress

quote: If you were to gather all the minutes wasted on insignificant, immaterial yik yak spent throughout the day and add them up, how much misspent time do you think you'd have? One hour? Two hours? Consider the sunk cost on that. It's unacceptable. One minute wasted is one minute too much.
author: Ari Gold, The Gold Standard: Rules to Rule By
category: humor, inspirational, life, rules-to-rule-by, talk, the-gold-standard, time, time-management, work

quote: Managing time is an essential part of making life simpler. Time should be valued and treated as the limited resource it is. Through prioritizing and planning, time management becomes an integral part of day to day activities.
author: Susan Stovall, Practical Ways to Simplify Your Life

quote: The most important principle in your relationship with time is that time is perishable. No one can save time. It’s not like money. You can’t deposit the time you don’t use into an account and use it later. Time passes. Time is a constantly depleting resource. Once it’s gone, it’s gone, and you will never get it back.
author: Gudjon Bergmann, Empowerment Basics

quote: There’s no such thing as ‘not enough time’ out here in the woods. I don’t even have a watch. Time is my own, categorised as nothing more than ‘morning, afternoon, evening and night’.
author: Fennel Hudson, A Waterside Year - Fennel's Journal - No. 2

quote: The most powerful word in time management is NO.
author: Gudjon Bergmann, Yes! You Can Manage Stress

quote: Procrastination can be overcome with effective time management skills and strategies.
author: Robert Moment, How to Stop Procrastinating

quote: Essential to time-management is a change in focus, a change from being ‘busy’ to a focus on outcomes
author: Tony Buon, The Leadership Coach

quote: Broke people are busy with their time, wherein successful people are productive with their time.
author: Vishwas Chavan

quote: You may spend years being somebody to everybody, yet you can't find 60 seconds to be someone to someone else. Find the time today to be somebody's someone.
author: Robert J. Braathe

quote: if you rest at work, you will work at rest
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah, The Untapped Wonderer in You: Dare to Do the Undone
category: extra-time, purpose, rest, tenacity, time, time-management, work, work-hard

quote: If you wouldn't get up early for it, you shouldn't stay up late to do it.
author: Benjamin Lotter

quote: A minute teaches me sixty different ways to think about you.
author: Faraaz Kazi, Truly, Madly, Deeply

quote: A timesheet is the budget of time management
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: It is important to realize that needs and wants will be unique for every person
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: Bad management on your behalf does not constitute a crises in my life
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: Although it might be difficult to believe, each interruption involves a choice.
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: You can change your life to become YOUR life
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: You can easily have more time available in your life to do what is important to you
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: How do you eat an elephant? One bite at a time.
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: Do you really want to waste your precious time doing things that are neither important nor urgent?
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: As we don't live in a perfect world, try to spend 80% of your time doing important but not urgent activities
author: Eddie  de Jong, Time Management for a productive life

quote: Nothing consumes time like nothing.
author: Russell Ackoff

quote: One could say that someone who does nothing but wait is like a glutton whose digestive system processes great masses of food without extracting any useful nourishment. One could go further and say that just as undigested food does not strengthen a man, time spent in waiting does not age him.
author: Thomas Mann, The Magic Mountain

quote: Time is a hard-hearted rebel, we cannot fight him or can we beg him to slow down, wait for us or stop, all we have to do is to obey his strict rules, follow him and run, he doesn't get tired, and we musn't get tired too.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: agenda, fast, michael-bassey-johnson, rebel, rebellion, revolt, schedule, stage, time, time-management, timetable

quote: Time is our most valuable nonrenewable resource, and if we want to treat it with respect, we need to set priorities.
author: Albert-László Barabási, Bursts: The Hidden Pattern Behind Everything We Do

quote: Time is a created thing. To say, "I don't have time" is like saying "I don't want to.
author: Lau-tzu

quote: A key point to bear in mind: The value of attentiveness varies in proportion to its object. You’re better off not giving the small things more time than they deserve.
author: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

quote: Our culture reasons that because we fell there is not enough time, we should increase our pace, multitask, and fit more into our already overbooked days. But even though it is counterintuitive to popular wisdom, perhaps the more effective response to the limits of time is to live more fully in the moment, to savor it and expand it.
author: Carrie Newcomer, A Permeable Life: Poems & Essays

quote: You are asking for an extra hour after you have wasted a day.
author: gnalluap

quote: Time is an opportunity with every providence of God to reveal His Will.
author: JOEL NYARANGI AKOYA

quote: One of the very worst uses of time is to do something very well that need not to be done at all.
author: Brian Tracy, Eat That Frog!: 21 Great Ways to Stop Procrastinating and Get More Done in Less Time
category: laziness, procrastinating, procrastination, procrastinator, time-management, time-passing, wasting-time

quote: A man has no right to occupy another man’s time unnecessarily
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Every hour you are not going after your passion, making your dreams a reality or defining your purpose is an hour you can't get back. Is what you're doing right now, this day, this moment getting you closer to where you want to be? If not, readjust your focus. It's your future. Go get it!
author: Elizabeth Bourgeret
category: defining-your-purpose, do-it-now, future-inspirational, future-plans, goals-in-life, priorities, purpose-of-life, time-management, time-slipping, time-wasted

quote: It is not that we have too little time to do all the things we need to do , it is that we feel the need to do too many things in the time we have.
author: Gary Keller, The One Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results

quote: Our lives are made up of time, and the quality of our existence depends on our wise use of the moments we are given.
author: Alexandra Stoddard, Gift of a Letter: Giving the Gift of Ourselves-- Add Richness and Grace to Your Life Through the Art of Letter-writing

quote: Task switching exacts a cost few realize they are even paying.
author: Gary Keller, The One Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results

quote: It's not a good idea to cut back indiscriminately on what you read. The reason is that reading can save you time, because it gives you the opportunity to learn from other people's experience.
author: Kathryn Alesandrini, Survive Information Overload: The 7 Best Ways to Manage Your Workload by Seeing the Big Picture

quote: Time is a most versatile resource. It flies, marches on, works wonders, and will tell. It also runs out.
author: Kathryn Alesandrini, Survive Information Overload: The 7 Best Ways to Manage Your Workload by Seeing the Big Picture

quote: There is no such thing as time management. There is only the mindset that optimally manages the self and its actions.
author: Tony Dovale
category: leaderaship-development, organisational-culture, performance-optimisation, rethink-time-management, time-management, tony-dovale

quote: He put this engine [a silver pocket watch] into our ears, which made an incessant noise, like that of a water-mill: and we conjecture it is either some unknown animal, or the god that he worships; but we are more inclined to the latter opinion, because he assured us, (if we understood him right, for he expressed himself very imperfectly) that he seldom did any thing without consulting it. He called it his oracle, and said, it pointed out the time for every action of his life.
author: Jonathan Swift, Gulliver's Travels

quote: Time is not waiting for you
author: be wise on time spending because time is money .

quote: TIME: Today Is My Everything
author: Richie Norton
category: carpe-diem, inspiration, seize-the-day, time, time-investment, time-management, time-passing, timeless, timelessness, times

quote: The Bible says we're to be moderate in all things. It's good to help others but not at the expense of your own family.
author: Lori Copeland, Unwrapping Christmas

quote: Despite wearing a Rolex, I have no time.
author: Faraaz Kazi

quote: Time: no start no end, the most powerful force in nature, killing more people than 100 atomic bombs, generating thoughts & ideas. Devil&Good
author: Rossana Condoleo
category: time, time-creator, time-generator, time-management, time-passing, time-power

quote: No time for anything, little time for everything
author: Sonya Withrow

quote: The secret to your future is hidden in your daily routine. You have to be self—disciplined to spend your time wisely.
author: Michelle    Moore, Selling Simplified

quote: Forget physics, forget organic chem, forget reading James Joyce's Ulysses - organizing your time is one of the biggest challenges you'll face in your academic career.
author: Stefanie Weisman, The Secrets of Top Students: Tips, Tools, and Techniques for Acing High School and College

quote: Fast car . . . You can drive anywhere in just a few minutes and time becomes just another thing we take advantage of never appreciating each moment that passes as a blessing from God.
author: Sarah Price, Fields of Corn

quote: Once upon a time, time was in the hands of the poor. Those who sensibly, reasonably, and firmly held it. Extravagance is only today and tomorrow.
author: Mona Adnan

quote: It’s not about having enough time, it’s about makingenough time.
author: Rachael Bermingham

quote: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: Time equals life; therefore, waste your time and waste of your life, or master your time and master your life.
author: Alan Lakein

quote: How long will you wait for the right time to come? The right time is now and the right place is here.
author: J.P. Vaswani

quote: Your Purpose Should Dictate How You Spend Your Time
author: Brenda Johnson Padgitt

quote: I did not take off our clothes, and did not enter you, and did not touch you. However, we practice love.
author: باولو كويلو, Eleven Minutes

quote: You can spend your whole life building a wall of facts between you and anything real.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: So you have to accept facts as fact.
author: Ai Yazawa

quote: Beyond the obvious facts that he has at some time done manual labour, that he takes snuff, that he is a Freemason, that he has been in China, and that he has done a considerable amount of writing lately, I can deduce nothing else.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Red Headed League
category: attributes, characteristics, detection, detectives, facts, obviousness, sherlock-holmes

quote: Facts are facts and will not disappear on account of your likes.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: The facts are always less than what really happened.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: There's nothing more stubborn than a fact. That is why you hate them so much. They offend you.
author: Tom Rob Smith, Child 44

quote: I am not one of those who in expressing opinions confine themselves to facts.
author: Mark Twain, What Is Man?

quote: Her mind was an hotel where facts came and went like transient lodgers, without leaving their address behind, and frequently without paying for their board.
author: Edith Wharton, Xingu and other Stories

quote: Facts must be faced. Vegetables simply don't taste as good as most other things do.
author: Peg Bracken, The Compleat I Hate to Cook Book

quote: If you’re purely after facts, please buy yourself the phone directory of Manhattan. It has four million times correct facts. But it doesn’t illuminate.
author: Werner Herzog
category: facts, illuminate, interview, manhattan, npr, phone-directory

quote: Sit down before fact with an open mind. Be prepared to give up every preconceived notion. Follow humbly wherever and to whatever abyss Nature leads or you learn nothing. Don’t push out figures when facts are going in the opposite direction.
author: Hyman G. Rickover

quote: Lord Peter Wimsey: Facts, Bunter, must have facts. When I was a small boy, I always hated facts. Thought they were nasty, hard things, all nobs. Mervyn Bunter: Yes, my lord. My old mother always used to say... Lord Peter Wimsey: Your mother, Bunter? Oh, I never knew you had one. I always thought you just sort of came along already-made, so it were. Oh, excuse me. How infernally rude of me. Beg pardon, I'm sure. Mervyn Bunter: That's all right, my lord. Lord Peter Wimsey: Thank you. Mervyn Bunter: Yes indeed, I was one of seven. Lord Peter Wimsey: That is pure invention, Bunter, I know better. You are unique. But you were going to tell me about your mater. Mervyn Bunter: Oh yes, my lord. My old mother always used to say that facts are like cows. If you stare them in the face hard enough, and they generally run away. Lord Peter Wimsey: By Jove, that's courageous, Bunter. What a splendid person she must be. Mervyn Bunter: I think so, my lord.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers, Clouds of Witness

quote: The way to do research is to attack the facts at the point of greatest astonishment.
author: Celia Green

quote: Mathias shrugged. After all, a criminal lawyer is not concerned with facts. He is concerned with probabilities. It is the novelist who is concerned with facts, whose job it is to say what a particular man did do on a particular occasion: the lawyer does not, cannot be expected to go further than show what the ordinary man would be most likely to do under presumed circumstances.
author: Richard Hughes, A High Wind in Jamaica

quote: He had a respect for facts maybe this was one.
author: Anne Carson, Autobiography of Red

quote: There is a point when a personal opinion shades off into an error of fact.
author: Gene Siskel

quote: everyday is a holiday somewhere in the world
author: Anjaani

quote: Whatever happens right now, it has to happen.
author: Jayson Engay

quote: Help yourself before you help others.
author: Jayson Engay

quote: These were the facts. Facts were important. They separated fiction from reality, the tawdry world of Mike Longshott from the concrete spaces of Joe's world.
author: Lavie Tidhar, Osama

quote: I'm sure there's some hexplanation. Within every beast there's always some beauty! It's not fair to assume that anyone is bad before we all know the facts. Maybe it's just a misunderstanding and there is no bad beast at The End of this story. But the only way we're ever-after going to find out is by getting to the bottom of this!
author: Perdita Finn, Ever After High: Once Upon a Twist: Rosabella and the Three Bears

quote: Some things never change
author: Jeffrey Archer, Mightier Than the Sword

quote: Men often fall in love at first sight
author: Jeffrey Archer, This Was a Man

quote: A mass of Latin words falls upon the facts like soft snow, blurring the outlines and covering up the details...
author: George Orwell, Politics and the English Language

quote: •	Scientific and medical studies, research or evidence is either distorted and misrepresented, or disputed or outright ignored by opponents whose views are threatened by the facts, in public shows of articles, statements, websites and even legislation. Scientific facts are ignored or dismissed as being ‘a liberal agenda’ or ‘merely propaganda’.
author: Christina Engela, The Pink Community - The Facts
category: a, and, articles, distorted, facts, in, legislation, liberal, misrepresented, or, outright, propaganda, public, research, scientific, statements, studies, views, websites, whose

quote: I like facts... but sometimes too much of it... just puts limits in your head.
author: Deyth Banger, Notes Of A Dead Man Sequel

quote: Facts and truth really don’t have much to do with each other.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Turns out all it takes to bring enemies to peace is a bigger enemy.
author: Soman Chainani, The School for Good and Evil Series Box Set: Books 1-3

quote: Dodd acknowledged Congress's reluctance to become entangled abroad but added, "I do, however, think facts count; even if we hate them.
author: Erik Larson

quote: Love comes with faith.
author: Jayson Engay

quote: Have a seat with me,” Caine said, hopping down from the wall. “How have you been, Taylor?”“Life’s one big party,” she said.He laughed appreciatively at her joke. “Things must be pretty bad for Edilio to send for me, huh?”“Things are always pretty bad,” she said. “We’re at a new level of bad. I saw those bugs.”Caine mustered all his sincerity. “I have to go and fight these creatures. But I don’t know much about them.”Taylor told him what she knew. Caine felt some of his confidence drain away as she laid out the facts in gruesome detail and with complete conviction.“Well, this should be fun,” Diana said dryly. “I’m so glad we came back.
author: Michael  Grant, Plague
category: bugs, caine-soren, diana-ladris, edilio, facts, situation, taylor

quote: The Kerguelen Islands in the southern Indian Ocean are a six-day boat ride from Madagascar, and their only inhabitants are French scientists.
author: Cary McNeal, Are You Sh*tting Me?: 1,004 Facts That Will Scare the Crap Out of You

quote: It's nice to believe that when confronted with facts people will just suddenly respond to them but, in fact, most people don't really work like that.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: The story unfolded quickly as I typed, in a way I was becoming familiar with. There was something about putting the truth on paper, bringing facts into the light of day where everyone could look at them, that made my fingers move faster -- it was becoming one of my favorite sensations on earth.
author: Gwenda Bond, Double Down
category: double-down, facts, gwenda-bond, journalism, lois-lane, sensations, truth-telling, typing, writing

quote: The idea of “art for art’s sake” is a recent Western cultural phenomenon that in some ways both distracts and diminishes the reality of human creative expressions. If we define art broadly, then it permeates virtually every aspect of our lives. All of us search for and attempt to create that which is aesthetically pleasing; thus, we are all “artists.
author: James Peoples, Humanity: An Introduction to Cultural Anthropology

quote: China uses about half of the world’s cement for its new roads and buildings.According to the World Bank in 2007, China had 16 of the world’s 20 most polluted cities.One day in January 2013, the air pollution index in Beijing was 755—measured on a scale of 0 to 500!In late 2012, 16,000 dead pigs were found floating in the river that supplies water toShanghai, the PRC’s largest city. For 2010, a ministry of the Chinese government estimated the monetary cost of the environmental damage caused by rapid industrialization at $230 billion, which is 3.5 percent of China’s gross domestic product.Air pollution from Chinese factories wafts over to the Koreas and Japan. Sometimes, upper atmospheric winds carry the sulphur dioxide from China’s coal-burning clear over to North America’s west coast.
author: James Peoples, Humanity: An Introduction to Cultural Anthropology

quote: In Japan:The shortage of wives for farmers became a rural crisis. In one village in the late 1980s, of unmarried persons between ages 25 and 39, 120 were men and only 31 were women, a ratio of 4:1. Some Japanese villages organized to find wives for their bachelors. One mountain village placed newspaper ads, promising free winter skiing vacations to all young women who visited and agreed to meet its men. Over a fiveyear period, 300 women responded, but none became wives of a villageman. In another mountain village of 7,000, there were three bachelors for every unmarried woman, so the local government became a marriage agent. It brought in 22 women from the Philippines, South Korea, Thailand, and other Asian countries to marry its men, many in their 40s and 50s. Some marriages endured, but others ended in divorce because of the labor demands of farm life, the burden wives bore in caring for their husband’s elderly parents, and cultural differences. Small businesses developed that offered counseling services for bicultural couples and served as marriage brokers to match Japanese men with foreign women. Even today, many Japanese farm men remain bachelors. Farming in Japan is now primarily a part-time occupation—farmers find off-season jobs in construction or other tasks, unable to make an acceptable living even with government subsidies. And farming is now largely performed by older persons. For example, in one important rice-growing area, between 1980 and 2003, the number of people making most of their money from farming fell by 56 percent, and the number of people between ages 15 and 59 fell by 83 percent. There was one increase, though: there were 600 more farmers older than 70 in 2003 than in 1980.
author: James Peoples, Humanity: An Introduction to Cultural Anthropology

quote: Truth is always a factual right...It is not always an absolute right...
author: Swaran Jaggi

quote: Everyone is entitled to his own opinion, but not his own facts.
author: Patrick Moynahan

quote: At the very best there are two major problems with ideology. The first is that it does not represent or conform to or even address reality. It is a straight-edge ruler in a fractal universe. And the second is that it inspires in its believers the notion that the fault here lies with miscreant fact, which should therefore be conformed to the requirements of theory by all means necessary.
author: Marilynne Robinson, When I Was a Child I Read Books

quote: You can't achieve the dream if you're pleasing the team
author: Bandile M Matsenjwa

quote: When it comes to scary business, I believe that forewarned is forearmed.
author: Cary McNeal, Are You Sh*tting Me?: 1,004 Facts That Will Scare the Crap Out of You

quote: In the Middle Ages, bloodletting was often performed by barbers, which is why the traditional barber’s pole—like the bloody towels that once hung outside barber shops—is colored red and white.
author: Cary McNeal, Are You Sh*tting Me?: 1,004 Facts That Will Scare the Crap Out of You

quote: The Japanese island of Okunoshima, also called “Rabbit Island” after the many furry inhabitants who live there, was once home to Japan’s poison gas factories. The rabbits are descendants of ones used for chemical testing during World War II.
author: Cary McNeal, Are You Sh*tting Me?: 1,004 Facts That Will Scare the Crap Out of You

quote: The most isolated inhabited island in the world is Tristan da Cunha, an active volcano located in the middle of the south Atlantic Ocean 1,242 miles (2,000 kilometers) from the nearest land. Tristan da Cunha is Portuguese for “Where the fuck are we?!
author: Cary McNeal, Are You Sh*tting Me?: 1,004 Facts That Will Scare the Crap Out of You

quote: You know the facts about me about which even i am unknown...
author: shivangi lavaniya

quote: Facts give way when faith is activated.
author: TemitOpe Ibrahim
category: bow-down, fact, facts, faith, give-way, inspirational, truth

quote: Fact is is always truth but truth is not always fact
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, The Great Pearl of Wisdom

quote: Facts which were new to me were daily presenting themselves to my mind.
author: Noah Webster

quote: You look especially beautiful this morning, Monza."That brought a smile to the corner of her mouth. The corner he couldn't see. "Well. Facts are facts.
author: Joe Abercrombie, Best Served Cold

quote: Love hurts. There is nothing as painful as heartbreak. But in order to learn to love again, you must learn to trust again.
author: Nicholas Sparks, Safe Haven

quote: But these notes make no pretense of being a record of fact. That isn't their object. They are merely notes of impressions, a record of vagrant thoughts, hopes, ideas that have floated through the mind of one present-day American. It is likely that I have not, and will not, put into them one truth, measuring by the ordinary standards of truth. It is my aim to be true to the essence of things. That's what I'm after.
author: Sherwood Anderson, A Story Teller's Story

quote: You will never feel the dark when u look at a light... Just look at the bright side of the things you will never mind your struggles
author: Giridhar Alwar

quote: Do not evaluate things when you feel happiness
author: Mahmud A. Ibrahim

quote: Only the simplest of facts can be accepted as an undisputed truth.
author: Eraldo Banovac

quote: Don’t tell me your evaluation. Give me the facts.
author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

quote: Scientists are those who change facts
author: Farid F. Ibrahim

quote: Good days came when the bad days gone.
author: shiekha

quote: The fewer the facts, the stronger the opinion.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

quote: The ocean is six miles deep.
author: Joe Dunthorne, Submarine

quote: It is easier to align our opinions with facts, than it is to align facts with our opinions.
author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau

quote: ... those selling abortion don't want them to have [the facts]," Virginia said heatedly. "Besides the Supreme Court doesn't agree with you. They judges seem to think we poor women would fall apart if we knew the facts, so they decided women don't have the right to know the full truth." She shook her head. "They've made it legal to withhold vital information, even when a woman requests it, for heaven's sake!
author: Francine Rivers, The Atonement Child

quote: Truth, with a capital T, was swapped for Fact with a capital F, then both lower-cased —facts the new trues.
author: Geoffrey Wood
category: christian-fiction, christianity, facts, grimrack, religion, truth

quote: To speculate without facts is to attempt to enter a house of which one has not the key, by wandering aimlessly round and round, searching the walls and now and then peeping through the windows. Facts are the key.
author: Julian Huxley, Essays in Popular Science
category: aimless, facts, key, search, speculate, wander

quote: Every day that we read the news we have the possibility of being confronted with a fact about our world that is wildly different from what we thought we knew.
author: Samuel Arbesman, The Half-life of Facts: Why Everything We Know Has an Expiration Date

quote: The true business of the philosopher, though not flattering to his vanity, is merely to ascertain, arrange and condense the facts.
author: John Leslie
category: arrange, ascertain, condense, facts, flattering, philosopher, philosophy, science, vanity

quote: I have always loved to begin with the facts, to observe them, to walk in the light of experiment and demonstrate as much as possible, and to discuss the results.
author: Giovanni Arduino
category: discussion, experiment, facts, love, observation, results, science

quote: But what are facts, really, except things we’ve already proven? There could be lots of almost-facts out there, still waiting for proof.
author: Kathryn Reiss, Intruders at Rivermead Manor: A Kit Mystery

quote: Facts are a strange thing . . . when you know the facts to be true, they turn you into a revolutionary.
author: Richard Diaz

quote: History is often made and buttressed by myths and folklore rather than facts.
author: Daikichi Irokawa, Age of Hirohito: In Search of Modern Japan

quote: The fact was never give a chance to the possibility
author: dhaniRT

quote: Cosmology is a science which has only a few observable facts to work with.
author: Robert Woodrow Wilson
category: cosmology, facts, nobel-laureate, nobel-lecture, observable, science

quote: Finding that no religion is based on facts and cannot therefore be true, I began to reflect what must be the condition of mankind trained from infancy to believe in errors.
author: Robert Owen
category: brainwashing, error, facts, indoctrination, religion, truth

quote: A law of nature is not a formula drawn up by a legislator, but a mere summary of the observed facts — a 'bundle of facts.' Things do not act in a particular way because there is a law, but we state the 'law' because they act in that way.
author: Joseph McCabe, The Existence Of God
category: act, facts, formula, law-of-nature, laws-of-nature, legislator, nature, summary

quote: Ive allways wondered what the 4 letters in the word LIFE stands for. I know understand that it stands for: Little Interesting Facts Everyday.
author: Armin Houman
category: facts, facts-of-life, inspiration, interesting, interesting-perspection-of-life, life, motivation, student-of-life

quote: I am concerned with facts of quite unverifiable intrinsic value, but which, by their absolutely unexpected violently fortuitous character, and the kind of associations of suspect ideas they provoke.
author: André Breton, Nadja

quote: When the things get hard, there is a success near about.
author: Lovely Goyal, I Love the Way You Love Me

quote: For the first time I saw a medley of haphazard facts fall into line and order. All the jumbles and recipes and hotchpotch of the inorganic chemistry of my boyhood seemed to fit into the scheme before my eyes—as though one were standing beside a jungle and it suddenly transformed itself into a Dutch garden.[Upon hearing the Periodic Table explained in a first-tern university lecture.]
author: C.P. Snow, The Search
category: chemistry, dmitri-ivanovich-mendeleev, dmitri-mendeleev, dutch, facts, mendeleev, order, periodic-table, science, university

quote: Facing facts is definitely preferable to facing defeat.
author: Gordon R. Dickson, Dorsai!

quote: Life and death live and die in exactly the same spot, the body.
author: Yann Martel, Beatrice and Virgil

quote: Ive tried and tried and now I give up. I refuse to be the perfect friend to people that cant treat me with the same respect.
author: Lovely Goyal

quote: Life wasn't all fucking sunshine and rainbows. Real life was hard.
author: Kendall Ryan, Hard to Love
category: broken-hearted, facts, life-lessons, life-quotes, love, romance, truth

quote: The only measure of your success is in the number of people you have help.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: facts, good-seed, humane, life, offering, optimist, philanthropist, success, truth

quote: Man cannot be content in his riches even if he has the whole world, there must be a frivolous extra desire.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson, The Power of Creative Thoughts

quote: all fiction is better with explosions' said Jared. 'Basic fact of life.
author: Sarah Rees Brennan, The Spring Before I Met You

quote: Nobody should ever try to second-guess history
author: the facts are fantastic enough.
category: Louis L'Amour, Education of a Wandering Man

quote: There's no destiny
author: you just decide where you end.

quote: In order for a god to be all-knowing, he must know even the fact of his own omniscience. But can he do this? He may know the totality of facts constituting the world; call this Y. But in order to know that he has mastered Y, he must also know that 'There are no facts unknown to me' — and this is beyond Y.It seems impossible that a god (or anyone) could ever be sure that nothing exists beyond his ken. It makes no sense to imagine [a god] arriving at this limit, peering beyond it (at what?), and satisfying himself no further facts exist. But without this certainty he cannot be sure of his own omniscience, and so does not know everything.A theist might argue that his god has created all the facts in existence. But an omniscient god would have to be sure of even this — that he is the sole creator, and that there are no facts unknown to him. And how could he come to this knowledge?
author: Roland Puccetti
category: all-knowing, atheist-argument, atheist-arguments, certainty, contradiction, facts, impossibility, incompatible-attributes, knowledge, omniscience, paradox

quote: Lies written in ink cannot disguise facts written in blood.
author: Lu Xun

quote: The question of whether world peace will ever be possible can only be answered by someone familiar with world history. To be familiar with world history means, however, to know human beings as they have been and always will be. There is a vast difference, which most people will never comprehend, between viewing future history as it will be and viewing it as one might like it to be. Peace is a desire, war is a fact; and history has never paid heed to human desires and ideals ...
author: Oswald Spengler, Aphorisms

quote: They're called 'facts', and my role is to amplify those, not cheerlead. And I don't care at all what you think of my motives.
author: Glenn Greenwald
category: 2012, dissent, facts, journalism, politics, principle, twitter

quote: The value of an opinion is only measured by its user. It's ironic that the value of a fact is only measured by its observer.
author: Lionel Suggs

quote: We have heard talk enough. We have listened to all the drowsy, idealess, vapid sermons that we wish to hear. We have read your Bible and the works of your best minds. We have heard your prayers, your solemn groans and your reverential amens. All these amount to less than nothing. We want one fact. We beg at the doors of your churches for just one little fact. We pass our hats along your pews and under your pulpits and implore you for just one fact. We know all about your mouldy wonders and your stale miracles. We want a this year's fact. We ask only one. Give us one fact for charity. Your miracles are too ancient. The witnesses have been dead for nearly two thousand years.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll, The Gods and Other Lectures

quote: Memorization has gotten a bad rap recently. Lots of students, and even some educators, say that being able to reason is more important than knowing facts; and besides, why bother committing things to memory when you've got Google? My response to this - after I've finished inwardly groaning - is that of course reasoning is important, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't know facts as well. It's not like you have to choose between one or the other. Besides, facts give you a foundation on which to reason about things.
author: Stefanie Weisman, The Secrets of Top Students: Tips, Tools, and Techniques for Acing High School and College

quote: If certain Jewish communities had distinctive qualities, they were due to history, not biology.
author: Shlomo Sand, The Invention of the Jewish People

quote: Odd Fellows Chamber Music for 2013 will be in October this yearTo Participants in the Odd Fellows Youth Chamber Music Project:Because an elevator is being installed at the Lodge, probably during August, we have to change the date:Instead of the two-week August program, we will be holding a weekend Baroque Festival in October, with an emphasis on Bach. There will be groups of all sizes and levels.The Program will take place on October 19th and 20th, 2013. We will rehearse from 9:30 AM to 12 Noon, and from 1 PM to 5PM, on Saturday. We’ll be feeding you during the lunch break.The performance will be at 3 PM on Sunday October 20th. Reception after.We’ll still be keeping one person on each part, and without Conductors. We will be sending out applications soon. Probably the deadline will be July 1st. Hope you all can make it.If you know of anyone who has played in the past who hasn’t gotten this invitation, please have them contact us. We’re trying not leave anyone out. Cathy O’ConnorTed SeitzReality has a well-known liberal bias.
author: Stephen Co

quote: Not that anybody cares two pins about history in these days.We've got rid of history
author: history is all my eye. But I've got to tell you the facts.

quote: Facts are subversive
author: I.F. Stone

quote: Babies are born without knee-caps.
author: Reader's Digest Association

quote: The affair seems absurdly trifling, and yet I dare call nothing trivial when I reflect that some of my most classic cases have had the least promising commencement. You will remember, Watson, how the dreadful business of the Abernetty family was first brought to my notice by the depth which the parsley had sunk into the butter upon a hot day.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Adventure of the Six Napoleons/The Adventure of the Crooked Man
category: crimes, details, detection, facts, importance, sherlock-holmes, trifles, trivialities

quote: What's that?""The laundry basket?""No, next to it.""I don't see anything next to it.""It's my last shred of dignity. It's very small.
author: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Dignity does not consist in possessing honors, but in the consciousness that we deserve them.
author: Aristotle

quote: It's hard as hell to hold on to your dignity when the risen sun is too bright in your losing eyes, and that's what I was thinking about as we hunted for bad guys through the ruins of a city that didn't exist.
author: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Dignity is an affectation, cute but eccentric, like learning French or collecting scarves.
author: Dave Eggers, A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius

quote: Without dignity, identity is erased. In its absence, men are defined not by themselves, but by their captors and the circumstances in which they are forced to live.
author: Laura Hillenbrand, Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption
category: captivity, captor, captors, dignity, held-captive, imprisoned, stocholm-syndrome, survivors

quote: What people regard as vanity—leaving great works, having children, acting in such a way as to prevent one's name from being forgotten—I regard as the highest expression of human dignity.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Pilgrimage

quote: He made a good salary but he did not flaunt it. He’d been raised in Chicago proper by a Lithuanian Jewish mother who had grown up in poverty, telling stories, often, of extending a chicken to its fullest capacity, so as soon as a restaurant served his dish, he would promptly cut it in half and ask for a to-go container. Portions are too big anyway, he’d grumble, patting his waistline. He’d only give away his food if the corners were cleanly cut, as he believed a homeless person would just feel worse eating food with ragged bitemarks at the edges – as if, he said, they are dogs, or bacteria. Dignity, he said, lifting his half-lasagna into its box, is no detail.
author: Aimee Bender, The Particular Sadness of Lemon Cake

quote: LADIES!!!! You are not a SEXUAL OBJECT! - not a PUNCHING BAG _ not a target for EMOTIONAL ABUSE! You worth more than that! You were created by God to be a Partner to MEN not a SLAVE, to provide Strength and support to them not to be used and manipulated by them, to submit to them not to become fools in that process. You have your Dignity and Self Worth. Never sacrifice those!
author: bolanle john

quote: There were many words that you could not stand to hear and finally only the names of places had dignity. Certain numbers were the same way and certain dates and these with the names of the places were all you could say and have them mean anything. Abstract words such as glory, honor, courage, or hallow were obscene beside the concrete names of villages, the numbers of roads, the names of rivers, the numbers of regiments and the dates.
author: Ernest Hemingway, A Farewell to Arms

quote: Dignity is as essential to human life as water, food, and oxygen.
author: Laura Hillenbrand, Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption

quote: If you make a fool of yourself, you can do it with dignity, without taking your pants down. And if you do take your pants down, you can still do it with dignity.
author: William Shatner

quote: The dignity of man was everywhere tissue-paper thin.
author: Dick Francis, Banker

quote: There are some promotions in life, which, independent of the more substantial rewards they offer, acquire peculiar value and dignity from the coats and waistcoats connected with them. A field-marshal has his uniform; a bishop his silk apron; a counsellor his silk gown; a beadle his cocked hat. Strip the bishop of his apron, or the beadle of his hat and lace; what are they? Men. Mere men. Dignity, and even holiness too, sometimes, are more questions of coat and waistcoat than some people imagine.
author: Charles Dickens, Oliver Twistder Ungekürzte Originaltext

quote: Her profile as well as her stature and bearing seemed to gain the more dignity from her plain garments, which by the side of provincial fashion gave her the impressiveness of a fine quotation from the Bible,—or from one of our elder poets,—in a paragraph of to-day’s newspaper.
author: George Eliot, Middlemarch

quote: The most important thing is our dignity. If we have that we can survive on bread and water.
author: Richard Flanagan, Notes on an Exodus

quote: He’d valued his dignity more than his own life.
author: Hyeonseo Lee, The Girl with Seven Names: A North Korean Defector’s Story

quote: Shh,” Cobweb said with a well-time jab of the elbow, “we might be able to get some dignity out of this, if we play our cards right.
author: Lisa Mantchev, So Silver Bright

quote: She saw that supreme dignity - and love - lay in tolerance.
author: Antonia Fraser, King Charles II

quote: How to hold the dignity; one should prevent, to be a toy in the hands of others. Consequently, one stands independently with its dignity; otherwise toy stays toy for another's purpose and pleasure, nothing else.
author: Ehsan Sehgal

quote: There is plenty of dignity in just holding on
author: Steven Erikson, The Crippled God

quote: the very least we can live with is an agreement that does not reduce us to slaves of imposition, but makes us partners of consent. Yes, we are compelled to make peace, we submit to force majeure, but leave us at least a piece of clothing to cover our nudity. This is the motivation behind every formula of diplomatic contrivance that is sometimes described as face-saving, and wise indeed is the victor who knows that, in order to shield his own rear from the elements, he must not denude his opponents.
author: Wole Soyinka, Climate of Fear: The Quest for Dignity in a Dehumanized World

quote: When we spend time with people who live in extreme poverty, and we listen to their stories, it creates dignity and connectedness - something they usually lack.
author: Chris Marlow, Doing Good Is Simple: Making a Difference Right Where You Are

quote: To respect my nature is to know my nature.
author: Petra Hermans, Voor een betere wereld

quote: It is the lowered head that makes her seem less noble than, say, a horse, or a deer surprised in the woods. More exactly, it is her lowered head and neck. As she stands still, the top of her head is level with her back, or even a little lower, and so she seems to be hanging her head in discouragement, embarrassment, or shame. There is at least a suggestion of humility and dullness about her. But all these suggestions are false.
author: Lydia Davis, Can't and Won't: Stories

quote: We may now understand better, too, why my father was so fond of the story of the butler who failed to panic on discovering a tiger under the dining table; it was because he knew instinctively that somewhere in this story lay the kernel of what true ‘dignity’ is.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro, The Remains of the Day

quote: We will not run," Paul said. "We'll move with dignity. We'll do what must be done.
author: Frank Herbert, Dune Messiah

quote: The proper name for the thing is modesty; but as we live in an age of prejudice and must not call things by their right names, we will yield to a more modern nomenclature and call it dignity.
author: G.K. Chesterton, What's Wrong with the World

quote: Life is harder than you thought, you must face the challenges that comes to your life and fight with Love and Dignity in-order to have a successful life.
author: Lenny Ramirez

quote: She will at least be decently clothed as she waits. Tomorrow I shall find her a brush and powder and whatever else a woman of her dignity requires.” Fin rolled her eyes. “Is ‘dignity’ what you call it?” Jeannot offered her his hand. Fin took it and pulled herself up from the deck. She was barefoot and her pants and shirt were stained with everything from blood to oakum to lampblack. She stretched her shirt out between her hands and considered its mottle of stains. “I’m not dignified?” she asked. When Fin looked up, Jeannot had an eyebrow cocked high and one side of his mouth was curled in amusement. “Where you are concerned, much requires redefinition.
author: A.S. Peterson, Fiddler's Green

quote: A central part of the torturer’s craft is to make his job easier by stripping the victim of protective dignity.
author: Jonathan Glover, Humanity: A Moral History of the Twentieth Century

quote: Dignity is to have a dream, a strong one, which gives you a vision, a world where you have a place, where whatever it is you have to contribute makes a difference.
author: Fatema Mernissi

quote: It’s always better to sit on your dignity in private than to stand on it in public.
author: Mark  Lawrence, Prince of Fools

quote: You ask me to make a promise? I am in a cage. No promise I make is trustworthy because I would do anything to be rid of this cage. Promise me that you will not treat me like an animal or a spectacle, and I will see what I can do.
author: J.M. McDermott, Straggletaggle

quote: Though one’s occupation for his or her livelihood involves physical work or menial labour, it is held that the job carries dignity, compared to the jobs that involve more intellect than body.
author: dignity,labor,indicates,types,jobs,respected,equally,,occupation,considered,superior,livelihood,invo
category: compared, dignity, intellect, involve, livelihood, menial, occupation

quote: Remember the son of whom you are because a good name is better than gold or silver
author: Emmanuel Olawale, The Flavor of Favor: Quest for the American Dream. A Memoir

quote: I'd seriously contemplated a real collar - a sparkly green one - if only because I was sure it would offend his dignity.
author: Kelley Armstrong, Omens

quote: All labor has dignity.
author: Martin Luther King Jr., The Autobiography of Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: There’s a dignity in consequences.
author: James S.A. Corey, Cibola Burn

quote: A palm-leaf carriage should move slowly, or else it loses its dignity.
author: Sei Shōnagon, The Pillow Book

quote: Don’t a man has serf esteem, it’s only woman who is sign of dignity, don’t man have their own?
author: Junaid Raza

quote: On the one hand the younger son realizes that he has lost the dignity of his sonship, but at the same time that sense of lost dignity makes him also aware that he is indeed the son who had dignity to lose," (pp. 49).
author: Henri J.M. Nouwen, The Return of the Prodigal Son: A Story of Homecoming

quote: The god abandons AntonyWhen at the hour of midnight an invisible choir is suddenly heard passingwith exquisite music, with voices ― Do not lament your fortune that at last subsides, your life’s work that has failed, your schemes that have proved illusions. But like a man prepared, like a brave man, bid farewell to her, to Alexandria who is departing. Above all, do not delude yourself, do not say that it is a dream, that your ear was mistaken. Do not condescend to such empty hopes. Like a man for long prepared, like a brave man, like the man who was worthy of such a city, go to the window firmly, and listen with emotion but not with the prayers and complaints of the coward (Ah! supreme rapture!) listen to the notes, to the exquisite instruments of the mystic choir,and bid farewell to her, to Alexandria whom you are losing.
author: Constantinos P. Cavafis, Selected Poems

quote: It’s a matter of dignity,” the Chief explained. “At a certain point, that’s all you have left.
author: Tom Perrotta, The Leftovers

quote: To assert dignity is to lose it.
author: Rex Stout, The League of Frightened Men

quote: one of the most painful things in life is to be considered as meaningless in an environment where you think you are truly meaningful
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah, Distinctive Footprints of Life: Where Are You Heading Towards?
category: dignity, inspirational-quotes, life, pain, purpose, relationships, respct

quote: we may have a better reflection of ourselves in the mirror depending on how thick the opaque substance behind it is; the lighter the substance, the poorer the image; the thicker the substance,the better the image.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah, Distinctive Footprints of Life: Where Are You Heading Towards?
category: dignity, inspirational-quotes, life, life-lessons, people, purpose

quote: We are quiet, contemplative people, and our behaviour in the field is relatively aristocratic. Running is not necessarily beneath our dignity but it is in any case pointless because the flies move much too fast. Consequencly, we stand still, as if on guard, and moreover almost exclusively in blazing sunshine, little breeze and fragrant flowers. Passersby can therefore easily get the impression that the fly hunter is a convalescent of some kind, momentarily lost in meditation. This is not wholly inaccurate.
author: Fredrik Sjöberg, The Fly Trap

quote: What humanity wants most is crude sensation.Really? I thought what humanity wanted most was dignity.
author: Christopher Fowler, Full Dark House

quote: The thing about dignity: it can be destroyed, but not taken unless it's given away. It can always be beautified.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker

quote: The women in porn plead to be abused. They call themselves whores and sluts. They are beaten and penetrated by groups of men. Their faces are covered with semen from dozens of masturbating men, their anuses are penetrated repeatedly by lines of partners, and they are raped. The women portrayed in the films exist to fulfill the desire of men in the most degrading and painful way possible. Nearly all porn dialogue includes lines from women such as I am a cunt, I am a bitch. I am a whore. I am a slut.
author: Chris Hedges, Empire of Illusion: The End of Literacy and the Triumph of Spectacle
category: curse, degrade, dignity, insult, porn, pornography

quote: I'm not obliged to defend your dignity. Provided you have any.
author: Rachel Caine, Last Breath
category: dignity, humor, last-breath, morganville-vampires, oliver, rachel-caine

quote: Once upon a time, my government turned my city into a police state, kidnapped me, and tortured me. When I got free, I decided that the problem wasn’t the system, but who was running it. Bad guys had gotten into places of high office. We needed good apples. I worked my butt off to get people to vote for good apples. We had elections. We installed the kind of apples everyone agreed would be the kind of apples we could be proud of. They said good things. A few real dirtbags like Carrie Johnstone lost their jobs.	And then, well, the good apples turned out to act pretty much exactly like the bad apples. Oh, they had reasons. There were emergencies. Circumstances. It was all really regrettable. 	But there were always emergencies, weren’t there?
author: Cory Doctorow, Homeland
category: bad-apples, change, dignity, freedom, good-apples, police-state

quote: Take care of your common sense, and your dignity will take care of itsself
author: Carolyn Wells, Patty at Home

quote: The more you learn about the dignity of the gorilla, the more you want to avoid people.
author: Dian Fossey

quote: Frank, I ran into Gladys and Billy at the store yesterday. Do you know what he said to me?"The girls went very quiet. Frank didn't look up."Hello?" he asked, and kept rubbing Henry's knife.Dotty hit him with her rag. "He said that. And so did she. But the important part was when he said, 'Frank ever get that door open?' Do you know what I said? What I said was--Are you ready for this? I said, 'No,'""Ah" Frank said. He lifted Henry's knife up to his mouth and dabbed the blade with his tongue. "That's my honest wife. I appreciate you lookin' out for my dignity.
author: N.D. Wilson, 100 Cupboards

quote: Someone said: "“Tell me what you read and I'll tell you who you are"or "tell me who is your friend and I'll tell you who you are" ...etc..My life experience oppose the above mentioned sayings.I would say, "Tell me how do you respond to gossip and I will tell you who you are" "Tell me how do you solve your problems and I'll tell you who you are
author: Mahsati Abdul

quote: It’s hard as hell to hold on to your dignity when the risen sun is too bright in your losing eyes
author: John Green

quote: Class never runs scared.It is sure-footed and confident.It can handle anything that comes along.Class has a sense of humor.It knows a good laugh is the best lubricant for oiling the machinery of human relations.Class never makes excuses.It takes its lumps and learns from past mistakes.Class knows that good manners are nothing more than a series of small, inconsequential sacrifices.Class bespeaks an aristocracy that has nothing to do with ancestors or money.Some wealthy “blue bloods” have no class, while individuals who are struggling to make ends meet are loaded with it.Class is real.It can’t be faked.Class never tried to build itself by tearing others down.Class is already up and need not strive to look better by making others look worse.Class can “walk with kings and keep it’s virtue and talk with crowds and keep the common touch.” Everyone is comfortable with the person who has class because that person is comfortable with himself.If you have class, you’ve got it made.If you don’t have class, no matter what else you have, it doesn’t make any difference.
author: Ann Landers

quote: How can anyone love someone who is less than a full person, unless love itself is domination per se?
author: Andrea Dworkin, Intercourse

quote: Perhaps we just need little reminders from time to time that we are already dignified, deserving, worthy. Sometimes we don't feel that way because of the wounds and the scars we carry from the past or because of the uncertainty of the future. It is doubtful that we came to feel undeserving on our own. We were helped to feel unworthy. We were taught it in a thousand ways when we were little, and we learned our lessons well.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quote: Haste denies all acts their dignity.
author: Dante Alighieri, Purgatorio

quote: Dignity is a value that creates irreplaceability.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: There was hardly a touch of earth in her love for Clare. To her sublime trustfulness he was all that goodness could be—knew all that a guide, philosopher, and friend should know. She thought every line in the contour of his person the perfection of masculine beauty, his soul the soul of a saint, his intellect that of a seer. The wisdom of her love for him, as love, sustained her dignity; she seemed to be wearing a crown. The compassion of his love for her, as she saw it, made her lift up her heart to him in devotion. He would sometimes catch her large, worshipful eyes, that had no bottom to them looking at him from their depths, as if she saw something immortal before her.
author: Thomas Hardy, Tess of the D'Urbervilles

quote: I also remember being struck by de Sade's will, in which he asked that his ashes be scattered to the four corners of the earth in the hope that humankind would forget both his writings and his name. I'd like to be able to make that demand; commemorative ceremonies are not only false but dangerous, as are all statues of famous men. Long live forgetfulness, I've always said—the only dignity I see is in oblivion.
author: Luis Buñuel, My Last Sigh
category: ashes, de-sade, death, dignity, legacy, marquis-de-sade, oblivion

quote: Dignity is a bridge.It needs two sides that, being different, distinct and distant become one in the bridgewithout ceasing to be different and distinct, but ceasing already to be distant.
author: Zapatistas

quote: As she continues to answer questions about her employment, all these words mean little more to her now than I AM SOPHISTICATED, I AM WORTHY, I AM SOPHISTICATED, I AM WORTHY. She attempts the posture of a politician's wife, shoulders held back, dignifIed yet modest.
author: Tania James, Atlas of Unknowns

quote: All lived lives of dignity and repression.
author: Mary Lou Foster Cooper

quote: …a man's value should be gauged by how much value he places on the entire concept of humanity.” - Dami K.
author: Ray Anyasi, To Live Again

quote: Everything. Everywhere. Every moment. That is the scope of God's call on our lives, and that is the dignity our lives enjoy.
author: John G. Stackhouse Jr., Making the Best of It: Following Christ in the Real World

quote: I can’t do nothing for you either, Billy. You know that. None of us can. You got to understand that as soon as a man goes to help somebody, he leaves himself wide open. He has to be cagey, Billy, you should know that as well as anyone. What could I do? I can’t fix your stuttering. I can’t wipe the razorblade scars off your wrists or the cigarette burns off the back of your hands. I can’t give you a new mother. And as far as the nurse riding you like this, rubbing your nose in your weakness till what little dignity you got left is gone and you shrink up to nothing from humiliation, I can’t do anything about that, either.
author: Ken Kesey, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

quote: Every morning in Africa, a gazelle wakes up, it knows it must outrun the fastest lion or it will be killed. Every morning in Africa, a lion wakes up. It knows it must run faster than the slowest gazelle, or it will starve. It doesn't matter whether you're the lion or a gazelle-when the sun comes up, you'd better be running.
author: Christopher McDougall, Born to Run: A Hidden Tribe, Superathletes, and the Greatest Race the World Has Never Seen

quote: People sometimes sneer at those who run every day, claiming they'll go to any length to live longer. But don't think that's the reason most people run. Most runners run not because they want to live longer, but because they want to live life to the fullest. If you're going to while away the years, it's far better to live them with clear goals and fully alive then in a fog, and I believe running helps you to do that. Exerting yourself to the fullest within your individual limits: that's the essence of running, and a metaphor for life — and for me, for writing as whole. I believe many runners would agree
author: Haruki Murakami, What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

quote: All I do is keep on running in my own cozy, homemade void, my own nostalgic silence. And this is a pretty wonderful thing. No matter what anybody else says.
author: Haruki Murakami, What I Talk About When I Talk About Running
